container-title: Click "Easy Install". 4) When the installation is complete, quit the Installer
title: After the hard disk has been initialized, quit HDSC Setup and launch the Installer

note: Then select "Shut Down" from the Special menu.
title: When you are done, select "Empty Trash" from the Special menu and close all open windows

note: and holding down the Shift key, select "Apple II Setup (v2.0.1)".
title: Launch the Installer and select "AppleShare File Server (v2.0.1
When asked if you want to "Prepare volume 'A2' for use with AppleShare?", click OK. You'll be asked to give the file server a name, for example, "Apple II Forever"
Next, the system will prompt you for a Users and Groups file. Open the Server Folder and click "New". Create users and groups according to your needs and preferences, starting with the Administrator
When you are done, select "Save Users and Groups as..." from the File menu and save the Users and Groups in the Server folder

note: and click on the check box marked "Apple II Features".
title: Under the Server menu select "Server Info

container-title: If you have one drive, eject the System.Tools disk
title: Launch the Installer from System.Tools. If you have two drives, eject the System.Disk

container-title: Then select the AppleShare File Server volume and mount it. Close the graphic Control Panel
title: Select the file server and connect using the Administrator name and password
Select the optional scripts you need by holding down the Open Apple key when you click on them
When the installation is complete, hold down the Control Open-Apple Escape keys to enter the text Control Panel
